*Also, Visiting Professor in Earth Science and Engineering at Imperial College London.', 'title': 'Principal Research Geomechanics Specialist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Shell Canada Limited/IS Global Solutions Inc', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Calgary, Alberta, Canada/Houston, Texas, USA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Shell Canada Limited/IS Global Solutions Inc', 'description': '*Responsibilities included assuring integration across technical disciplines and organizations necessary to execute heater R&D technology development for in-situ upgrading of heavy oil, and oil-shale conversiion, including effective technology selection and maturation processes. 
*Tasks also include mentoring less experienced staff and acting as a focal point to lead and guide the research development and engineering design of the heater systems and components.
*Aso, visiting Professor in Earth Science and Engineering at Imperial College London..

Highlights - Focal point for self-regulating and formation Joule heating technologies. Crucial input into design and modeling of a formation Joule heating test in a shallow resource.
*Summarized all previous development work on the self-regulating heater program for possible future application in oil shale.
*Provided crucial insights into the issue of long-term heater MgO electrical insulant integrity
*Application of key physics and mathematical skills to address a number of issues of importance to the heater program,  such as insulant thermal runaway, determining MgO thermal conductivity and the proper way to determine effective thermal conductivity in a layered medium such as oil shale. Also played a key part in the interpretation of a test of the feasibility of a pressure driven traveling thermocouple in a horizontal heater well.', 'title': 'Principal Heater Technical Advisor', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Shell Canada Limited', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Calgary, Alberta, Canada', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'company': 'Shell Canada Limited', 'description': '*Managed one Full-Time Employee (FTE), working on heater reliability, and one 16-month intern working on multiphase metering for heavy oil.
*Liaison role between the thermal modeling and heater teams within Unconventional Oil.
*Visiting Professor at Imperial College London.

Highlights - My FTE and introduced analytical and numerical techniques for optimizing the thickness and dielectric properties of screens used to reduce the maximum electric field strength in the heater insulant for a given applied voltage, thus increasing the safety factor for electrical breakdown.
*Taught the heater component of the Unconventional Oil 180 course piloted in 2009.', 'title': 'Manager Special Projects in Subsurface Rersearch and Engineering, Unconventional Oil', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Shell Exploration and Production Company', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Houston, Texas, USA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'company': 'Shell Exploration and Production Company', 'description': '*Project lead for the Circulating Molten Salt emerging concept until end February 2008. 
*Project lead for Formation Joule heating concept for accelerated in-situ mobility enhancement (March 2008-March 2009). 
*Visiting Professor in Earth Science and Engineering at Imperial College London.

Highlights - Finalized the selection of the salt while lead. CMS is now in the mainstream heater program. *Coordinated the scoping stage of the in-situ mobility project leading to pre-screen and formulated IP-secured Formation Joule electrode designs.', 'title': 'Project Lead in Future and Emerging Technologies Team within Unconventional Oil', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Shell International Exploration and Production Inc./ Shell Exploration and Production Company', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Houston, Texas, USA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'company': 'Shell International Exploration and Production Inc./ Shell Exploration and Production Company', 'description': '*R&D Focal Point for Electric Heaters in SURE (Now Unconventional Technologies).
*Coordinator of European Union sponsored project "Improved Radiation Transport Modelling for Borehole Applications".
*Visiting Professor in Earth Science and Engineering at Imperial College London.

Highlights - Developed a suite of predictive tools for the power output of self-regulating electric heaters. These have been implemented in design optimization.
*Completed a comprehensive study of dielectric breakdown in mineral insulated cables, another type of heater being considered for use in unconventional oil recovery. The results have been implemented in the current suite of MI cable designs.
*Carried out extensive eddy current modeling work, which has led to redesign of overburden sections and wellheads.
*Demonstrated that apparently off-spec insulators destined for the Viking unconventional oil recovery pilot were, in fact, fit for purpose, thus avoiding a delay in the project start-up.
*European Union sponsored project was concluded successfully, on budget.
*At Imperial, have delivered seminar series on a wide range of topics. Some of the work was implemented in Unconventional Oil.
*Authored or co-authored a large number of patent publications.', 'title': 'Senior Staff Physicist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Shell International Exploration and Production, BV', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 1997}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rijswijk, The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 1997}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}}, 'company': 'Shell International Exploration and Production, BV', 'description': '*(From 1/97) Modeling the response of neutron logging tools to obtain a better interpretation of formation properties.
*(From 8/97) Geothermal energy venture development and subsurface modeling.
*(From 11/00) Coordinator EU Sponsored 5th Framework Project "Improved Radiation Transport Modeling for Borehole Applications".
*(From 11/00) SIEP Technical Focal Point for Technology Alliance with Imperial College.

Highlights - Greatly extended diffusion modeling to enable an improved interpretation of neutron capture logging.
*Showed in a few pages of calculation that two third-party geothermal initiatives that Shell was invited to support would not work.
*Pursued additional work to maintain skills developed during previous postings with Shell, such as Computational Fluid Dynamics modeling, applying it the twister, a novel type of gas-liquid separator. I also applied effective medium theory to predict the effective permeability of vuggy carbonates containing isolated vugs.
*During the low oil price period, I wrote a project proposal on nuclear logging soliciting European Union funding under the 5th Framework Programme. The project was accepted, and Shell, the only end user, achieved a leverage factor of six to one on its costs.
*Four GameChangers accepted, on geothermal energy, nuclear logging, electrokinetic logging and broadband dielectric logging.
*Heavily involved with external focus initiatives, primarily with Imperial College, but also with MIT, UT and Russian Academy of Sciences.
*Appointed Shell Visiting Professor in the Department of Earth Science and Engineering at Imperial College.
*Many students supervised during this posting.', 'title': 'Senior Research Physicist/Senior Staff Physicist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Shell International Oil Products', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 1992}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 1996}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 1992}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 1996}}, 'company': 'Shell International Oil Products', 'description': '*Address fundamentals of turbulence modeling (esp. swirling flows). 
*Application of Computational Fluid Dynamics to a wide range of process problems.

Highlights - Persuaded Shell Research and Technology Centre Amsterdam (now STCA) to adopt CFX as their main Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) code, later negotiating a GBP 72,000 deal to purchase a perpetual multiuser license jointly with SRTCT (Thornton), who ran it remotely on SRTCA’s SP2 cluster.
*Successfully combined work on the long-term turbulence modeling project with very short-term service-type work on process problems.
*The application of CFD to EP process problems was particularly successful. For PDO, the simulations showed that the increased water throughput forecast in order to maintain oil production at Yibal could be handled by modifying the internals of the four existing dehydration tanks, obviating the need to build a fifth 39 meter diameter tank. This saved USD 5,000,000, while the simulation work cost less than USD 20,000. Validation in the field was straightforward, as the increased throughput could be represented by routing the existing stream through fewer tanks after the modifications had been carried out. 
*My colleagues and I developed a vision for CFD in the chemical process industry that I presented as a keynote address to a large chemical engineering conference.', 'title': 'Senior Research Physicist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Shell Oil Company', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 1991}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 1992}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Houston, Texas, USA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 1991}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 1992}}, 'company': 'Shell Oil Company', 'description': "*Study the maturity of Large Eddy Simulation for industrial applications. 
*Investigate the application of Kerstein's linear eddy turbulence model to mixing problems.

Highlights - Generated much interest at the start of the assignment with a seminar on fractals and their application within the oil industry. Established new theoretical results for the Kerstein model and developed speeded-up codes. The main application of the model is as a subgrid-scale model for Large-Eddy simulation of combusting flows.", 'title': 'Research Physicist (Exchange Scientist)', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Shell Internationale Research Maatschappij BV', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 1985}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 1991}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rijswijk, The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 1985}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 1991}}, 'company': 'Shell Internationale Research Maatschappij BV', 'description': '*Undertake Fundamental study of pore-level mechanisms of displacement in porous media.
